parse.title: Board of Intermediate and Secondary Education, Abbottabad

text.*:
This article relies too much on references to primary sources. Please improve this by adding secondary or tertiary sources. (February 2014) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
Board of Intermediate and Secondary Education, Abbottabad
بورڈ برائے متوسط و ثانوی تعلیم، ایبٹ آباد‬
Agency overview
Formed 1990 (1990)
Jurisdiction
  • Haripur
  • Abbottabad
  • Mansehra
  • Battagram
  • Kohistan
Headquarters Abbottabad
34°9′26.37″N 73°15′7.23″E﻿ / ﻿34.1573250°N 73.2520083°E﻿ / 34.1573250; 73.2520083Coordinates: 34°9′26.37″N 73°15′7.23″E﻿ / ﻿34.1573250°N 73.2520083°E﻿ / 34.1573250; 73.2520083
Website biseatd.edu.pk

The Board of Intermediate and Secondary Education, Abbottabad, more commonly known as BISE Abbottabad, is an intermediate and secondary education governmental board located in Abbottabad, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. It is authorized with financial and administrative authority to organize, manage, regulate, develop and control intermediate and secondary education in general and accomplish examinations in the institutions affiliated with it. BISE Abbottabad came into being as a result of the break-up of Peshawar Board in 1990 under the North West Frontier Province Board of Intermediate and Secondary Education Act 1990. The organisation building is located on Murree Road, Abbottabad.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Jurisdiction
  • 2 See also
  • 3 References
  • 4 External links

Jurisdiction[edit]

Jurisdiction includes five districts, namely Haripur, Abbottabad, Mansehra, Battagram and Kohistan, encompassing an area of 17,194 square kilometres and a population of 3.47 millions.[2]

See also[edit]

  • Education in Pakistan
  • Education in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa

References[edit]

  1. ^ "BISE Abbottabad - profile". Urdu Wire. Archived from the original on 22 February 2014. Retrieved 22 February 2014. 
  2. ^ "BISE Abbottabad - Jurisdiction". Official website. Archived from the original on 2 February 2014. Retrieved 27 January 2014.
